thread.title: Obama Invites Trump To One Final White House Meeting
thread.title_full: Obama Invites Trump To One Final White House Meeting

author: Jack Davis
title: Obama Invites Trump To One Final White House Meeting
text:
Obama Invites Trump To One Final White House Meeting "... a great moment ..." Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
President Barack Obama will spend his final moments in the White House as president hosting the man he fought tooth and nail to keep from becoming elected. 
Tom Barrack, chairman of the inaugural committee for President-elect Donald Trump, said the outgoing president and Michelle Obama will abide by what has become a tradition and host Trump and his wife, Melania, on the morning of Jan. 20. 
“They’ll go to the White House, invited for coffee or tea, they’ll spend … half an hour there or so, and then they’ll go together,” Barrack said. “That’s a great moment, that’s a great moment.” Advertisement - story continues below 
Barrack called the invitation “very gracious.” 
After their meeting, the Trumps and Obamas will ride together to Capitol Hill for the inauguration. 
After Trump takes the oath of office to become the nation’s 45th president, the Obamas will leave Washington without returning to the White House. Advertisement - story continues below 
President George W. Bush and first lady Laura Bush hosted the Obamas when Obama was inaugurated in 2009. 
The Jan. 20 meeting is part of the schedule of events that takes place beginning on Jan. 19, when Trump and Vice President-elect Mike Pence will lay a wreath at Arlington National Cemetery . 
Later that day, a “Make America Great Again! Welcome Celebration” concert will take place at the Lincoln Memorial. 
Barrack said that despite comments from many top entertainers that they would not perform at Trump’s inauguration, the president-elect had a different plan from the start. Advertisement - story continues below
